eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Fishing Club
eventData.description:
Since 1948 Yale’s Fishing Club has brought student-anglers together. The club sponsors chartered fishing trips, small group trips, competitions, and workshops on fishing techniques, fly-tying, and fly-casting. Our club is open to any current Yale undergraduate or graduate students; however, faculty, staff and alumni may purchase a permit to fish the Edward C. Migdalski Pond at the Yale Outdoor Education Center in East Lyme, CT. The club is active throughout the year.

Meet with members for a brief overview of the club activities, history and benefits of membership.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Students for Carbon Dividends
eventData.description:
Students for Carbon Dividends is a nationwide group of student leaders harnessing energy and passion to light a path towards a bipartisan climate breakthrough. The carbon dividends strategy is already supported by the broadest climate coalition in American history, including the largest statement of economists of all time. It is also endorsed by hundreds of Student Body Presidents from all 50 states—the largest declaration of student leaders in US history.

That's because carbon dividends is a solution where all sides would win. It would cut emissions fast, while also driving clean energy innovation, creating jobs, protecting our families and communities, and ensuring continued opportunity and prosperity.
Together, we can save the world (actually). We invite you to join us in making history.

Join us to learn how we engage in Congressional action, navigate the climate sphere and unite hundreds of students across the country towards the biggest bipartisan climate breakthrough in history.

eventType.name: Cultural Centers
eventType.description: These events are created in coordination with the cultural centers and student groups that operate within them.

eventData.headline: House Org Fridays - Performance & Arts Groups
eventData.description:
Come learn more about the residential student groups affiliated with the Afro American Cultural Center. These events will be held every Friday at 6:30pm. This week, come learn more about the House’s Performance and Arts groups.

Join from PC, Mac, Linux, iOS or Android: https://yale.zoom.us/j/91403708613
Or Telephone：203-432-9666 (2-ZOOM if on-campus) or 646 568 7788
Meeting ID: 914 0370 8613
International numbers available: https://yale.zoom.us/u/ac898shwlp

eventData.headline: Yale Club Running
eventData.description:
Club Sports Running team. Organizes daily runs, and attends seasonal races.

Join us for a fun running-themed Kahoot and to ask questions about who we are and what we do!

eventData.headline: The Yale Politic
eventData.description:
We are Yale's oldest and only political journal, since 1947.

Join us for a meet and greet with Politic writers, editors and Managing Board! We might have to change the time once we have a better sense of everyone's availability.

eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Women's Club-2 Soccer
eventData.description:
As one of Yale's two women's club soccer teams, we are a close-knit family of soccer players who support each other on and off the field.

Drop by to chat with current C2 players and learn about Yale's club soccer scene and why we love C2!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Rural Students Alliance at Yale
eventData.description:
Recognizing that students from small towns and rural communities have particular experiences that are unique from their urban peers and impact the way they experience Yale, the Rural Students Alliance of Yale is a group for rural students at Yale to get to know and support one another with the goal of improving the experience of rural students at Yale. We also aim to increase the visibility of rurality on Yale’s campus, not only highlighting rural members of its student body but also increasing the presence of rurality in academic inquiry through guest speakers, panels, film screenings, and more.

Come meet the Rural Students Alliance at Yale! We are an organization that aims to create a community of support for students transitioning to Yale coming from the small town life, while also discussing our own identity and issues impacting rural areas worldwide.

eventData.headline: Women's C1 Club Soccer
eventData.description: Come learn about the Women's C1 Club Soccer Team! We practice twice a week all year, and compete against other schools in CT in the Fall. We're also a vibrant social team :)

eventType.name: Student Groups

eventData.headline: The Purple Crayon
eventData.description:
The Purple Crayon & Just Add Water

Two of Yale's improv groups, The Purple Crayon specializes in long-form improv, while Just Add Water is Yale's musical improv group.

Join The Purple Crayon and Just Add Water, two of Yale's improv groups, for a workshop! We'll play some games, get to know each other, and talk about comedy groups at Yale.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Precision Marching Band
eventData.description:
The YPMB is Yale's premier "marching" band, and we invite all students (and even faculty) to join us!  

Do you play an instrument? Great! Show off your skills while playing alongside YPMB members who are also in other groups, like the Yale Concert Band and the Symphony Orchestra. Always wanted to learn how to play one? Awesome! We can hook you up with an instrument and a teacher. Love appreciating music, but not playing it? Incredible! All of our music is student arranged (that's right-we get to play all the pop, rock, hip-hop, etc. music we want!)! Love the vibe of the band, but looking for a virtual art outlet? Join the Squids, who put together all of our props for halftime shows (re: our 40ft bald eagle prop). Got a good sense of humor? Help write and put together our halftime shows-every member of the band has input!

We could go on for pages trying to tell you what we are. You’d be best off to show up and find out, really. You won’t be disappointed!

YPMB Info Session!
Come meet the student Drum Major and Manager of the Yale Precision Marching Band! This is a very low-stakes information session-we have some cool facts about the band to share, you probably have some questions about us, and we'd love to get to know you!
